questions.question: What is a Bash script?
choices: A series of commands written in a file to automate tasks
A graphical user interface for Linux
A command to compile C programs
questions.answer: A series of commands written in a file to automate tasks

questions.question: What is the purpose of the shebang line (#!/bin/bash) in a Bash script?
choices: To specify the interpreter for executing the script
To define a variable in the script
To add comments to the script
To import libraries into the script
questions.answer: To specify the interpreter for executing the script

questions.question: Which command is used to make a Bash script executable?
How do you assign a value to a variable in a Bash script?
What is the purpose of the 'read' command in a Bash script?
choices: To display output to the console

questions.question: Which special variable represents all the arguments passed to a Bash script?
What is the syntax for an if statement in Bash scripting?
Which keyword is used to start a for loop in Bash scripting?
How do you define a function in a Bash script?
What does the '&&' operator do in Bash scripting?
choices: Executes the second command only if the first command succeeds
Executes the second command only if the first command fails
Executes both commands regardless of the success of the first command
Defines a comment in the script
questions.answer: Executes the second command only if the first command succeeds
